article_text:
Manitowoc Co. has agreed to add a representative to its board and adopt certain corporate governance provisions, settling a dispute with activist investor Carl Icahn that began in late December.

Manitowoc, a company that makes cranes and commercial food equipment, disclosed plans to split up and separate its crane and food-service-equipment segments in late January. The move came about a month after Mr. Icahn disclosed a 7.77% stake...
